arts.ttl: “The referee made the game exciting” – Granit Xhaka takes aim after dubious penalty decision
arts.sum: Bayer Leverkusen were in a comfortable 3-1 lead prior to Borussia Dortmund’s 79th minute penalty, a decision that Granit Xhaka questioned. Edmond Tapsoba had brought down Julien Duranville with a…

arts.ttl: Xabi Alonso explains Florian Wirtz’ absence from Bayer Leverkusen’s starting XI vs Dortmund
arts.sum: Florian Wirtz was named as a starter in Bayer Leverkusen’s line-up to face Borussia Dortmund on Friday evening but when he didn’t appear on the pitch, questions were asked. Prior…

arts.ttl: “We lacked a little conviction” – Sebastian Kehl analyses Borussia Dortmund defeat
arts.sum: “Maybe we lacked a little conviction,” Sebastian Kehl somewhat surprised many with his statement after Borussia Dortmund’s first Bundesliga defeat at home this season. Conceding three goals to Bayer Leverkusen…

arts.ttl: Nuri Şahin ‘expects’ depleted Borussia Dortmund to ‘play better’ after Leverkusen defeat
arts.sum: Borussia Dortmund suffered their first defeat of the season at the Westfalenstadion on Friday night against Bayer Leverkusen as the Bundesliga resumed following the winter break. In the lead-up to…

arts.ttl: Fastest goal this season?! Leverkusen score stunner inside THIRTY SECONDS!
arts.sum: Nathan Tella struck an early blow for Bayer Leverkusen in their Bundesliga clash with Borussia Dortmund.

arts.ttl: Patrik Schick and Bayer Leverkusen’s flying start catches Dortmund cold
arts.sum: The Bundesliga champions, Bayer Leverkusen, battled past their hosts Borussia Dortmund with two goals from Patrik Schick on Friday to move to within a point of the leaders, Bayern Munich, with a sixth straight league win. In a frenetic opening the visitors struck three times in the first 19 minutes as they enjoyed a perfect start to the year with the league resuming following a three-week winter break. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: MOTM Poll: Borussia Dortmund Kick Off 2025 with 3-2 Loss to Bayer Leverkusen
arts.sum: Jamie Gittens pulled one back immediately, but Schick grabbed his second of the night and gave Leverkusen a 3-1 lead 19 minutes into the game, rounding out an incredibly chaotic start to 2025 in the Bundesliga. BVB looked much better in the second half, plugging away and trying to mount a comeback, but this was only possible thanks to Leverkusen sitting back and allowing Dortmund to have a go.

arts.ttl: Bayer Leverkusen edge Borussia Dortmund in five-goal thriller
arts.sum: Patrik Schick struck twice as the Bundesliga resumed in scintillating fashion following the winter break, with Bayer Leverkusen edging a depleted Borussia Dortmund side 3-2 in the Matchday 16 opener. Nathan Tella sent shockwaves through the Dortmund faithful inside the opening minute, finding the net after just 25 seconds.

arts.ttl: Patrick Schick, a troubled Yan Couto, and more | Three things we learned as Bayer Leverkusen overcame Borussia Dortmund
arts.sum: As the Bundesliga returned from the Winterpause, Bayer Leverkusen overcame Borussia Dortmund with a breathtaking 3-2 victory at the Westfalenstadion to kickstart 2025 in phenomenal fashion. With the weather ensuring…

arts.ttl: Leverkusen boost title hopes with 3-2 win vs. BVB
arts.sum: Bayer Leverkusen battled past hosts Borussia Dortmund 3-2 with two goals from Patrik Schick on Friday to move within a point of leaders Bayern Munich.
